q: Press MUNCIE, Ind.-- U.S. Rep. Mike Pence discussed his political future-- in somewhat nonspecific terms-- while addressing students in a Central High School social studies class Friday. Mike Pence acknowledged he was considering maybe coming home and running for governor, but the Republican said he was likely months away from making a final decision. He didn't completely rule out seeking a seventh term representing Indiana's 6th District in the U.S. House. While it's

As one party source explained, What better thing to do than start meeting Republicans in other parts of the state if he can't raise money during this time period? Indeed, the state statute does not prevent Mike Pence `` from participating in party activities conducted by a regular party committee.'' Mike Pence , R-Ind., who is a favorite of fiscal and social conservatives but rejected appeals that he run for president, turned down an invitation to speak at CPAC, where he has appeared six times. At this time, the congressman is focusing his attention on Indiana, Mike Pence spokesman Matt Lloyd said.`` He hopes to participate in future CPAC opportunities as his schedule permits.'' Eric Schmidt also says he will act as an advisor to Page and co-founder Sergey Brin .`` As Google has grown, managing the business has become more complicated,'' Eric Schmidt said on Thursday. So Larry, Sergey Brin and I have been talking for a long time about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making-- and over the holidays we decided now was the right moment to make some changes to the way we are structured. No longer will the company be run by the`` triumvirate'' of Eric Schmidt as leader with Page and Sergey Brin as presidents. Eric Schmidt said Page, who was the company's founding CEO, is now ready

It screened to sold-out audiences at Tribeca, the American Film Festival in Los Angeles and the International Documentary Film Festival in Amsterdam. The film was lauded as one of the top ten documentaries of the year, by the International Documentary Association. Barry Ptolemy explores the social and philosophical implications and the potential threats technological advances pose to human civilization in interviews with world leader Colin Powell ; technologists Hugo de Garis , Peter Diamandis , Kevin Warwick , and Dean Kamen ;

, 22:16 EST Google announced Thursday that co-founder Larry Page would replace Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the Internet giant in April. Google said Eric Schmidt would remain with the company as executive chairman and focus on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships. The firm's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , will work on strategic projects and new products, Google said in a statement. It said the management changes would take effect on April 4.
